org.apache.beam.sdk.io.hdfs

Class HDFSFileSource<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.Source<T>
      • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.BoundedSource<KV<K,V>>
        • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.hdfs.HDFSFileSource<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of keys to be read from the source.
    V - The type of values to be read from the source.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, HasDisplayData
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AvroHDFSFileSource, SimpleAuthHDFSFileSource

    public class HDFSFileSource<K,V>
extends BoundedSource<KV<K,V>>
    A BoundedSource for reading files resident in a Hadoop filesystem (HDFS) using a Hadoop file-based input format.

    To read a PCollection of KV key-value pairs from one or more Hadoop files, use from(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<T>, java.lang.Class<K>, java.lang.Class<V>) to specify the path(s) of the files to read, the Hadoop FileInputFormat, the key class and the value class.

    A HDFSFileSource can be read from using the Read transform. For example: 

     
 HDFSFileSource<K, V> source = HDFSFileSource.from(path, MyInputFormat.class,
   MyKey.class, MyValue.class);
 PCollection<KV<MyKey, MyValue>> records = Read.from(mySource);

    The readFrom(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<T>, java.lang.Class<K>, java.lang.Class<V>) method is a convenience method that returns a read transform. For example: 

     
 PCollection<KV<MyKey, MyValue>> records = HDFSFileSource.readFrom(path,
   MyInputFormat.class, MyKey.class, MyValue.class);
    Implementation note: Since Hadoop's FileInputFormat determines the input splits, this class extends BoundedSource rather than OffsetBasedSource, since the latter dictates input splits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
